Question 28 
 
  
[Digital Logic (Combinational Circuit)] 
 
Consider the circuit shown below where the gates may have propagation delays. Assume that all signal 
transitions occur instantaneously and that wires have no delays. Which of the following statements about 
the circuit is are CORRECT ?
(A) With no propogation delays, the output 
Y
 is always logic zero. 
(B) With no propagation delays, the output 
Y
 is always logic one. 
 
(C) With propagation delays, the output 
Y 
 can have a transient logic one after 
X
 transition from logic
zero to logic one.

PAGE
22

(D) With propagation delays, the output 
Y
 can have a transient logic Zero after 
X 
transitions from logic
One to logic Zero 
 
  (A, C)

Question 28 
 
  
[Digital Logic (Combinational Circuit)] 
 
Consider the circuit shown below where the gates may have propagation delays. Assume that all signal 
transitions occur instantaneously and that wires have no delays. Which of the following statements about 
the circuit is are CORRECT ?
(A) With no propogation delays, the output 
Y
 is always logic zero. 
(B) With no propagation delays, the output 
Y
 is always logic one. 
 
(C) With propagation delays, the output 
Y 
 can have a transient logic one after 
X
 transition from logic
zero to logic one.

PAGE
22

(D) With propagation delays, the output 
Y
 can have a transient logic Zero after 
X 
transitions from logic
One to logic Zero 
 
  (A, C)
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
(a) If no progression delay then due to NOT gate one of the input will be always zero.

X (0/1)
